instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: Hi I have a Macbook 12 inch with no display external and internal also tried a good working display. The machine is turning on as all powerstates are there including S0 and cpu gets warm and has power. Display is missing backlight power as well as 5V, 3.3v is present. <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> has 8.6v on pin 3/4 and on the otherside once i got 8.6 and mostly 0.44v. For <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>, which is 0v, as well as <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> the enable signals are 0v. Any idea how to troubleshoot this piece of junk :)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: The usual common 00045 issue. I have no idea what it is at this time. If you want to experiment start with swapping out <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>, the common failure on these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: I guess its time for another visit to store.rossmanngroup.com :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="arnonabuurs, post: 38579"]I guess its time for another visit to store.rossmanngroup.com :)[/QUOTE]


A bad aftermarket audio flex cable did this for me.. try leaving the cable unplugged from the MLB and see. Also, if upside down will cause the same. 
These are definitely odd boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: worth a try, all seems to be OK all voltage is there no shorts also not on <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
[QUOTE="arnonabuurs, post: 38615"]worth a try, all seems to be OK all voltage is there no shorts also not on <CHIP>U4700</CHIP>[/QUOTE]

If you connect just the DCIN and display to the board, do you get image/ backlight with a good display? Had another couple of these that were crippled by the keyboard and tpad. 
if you get image, shut down and plug things in one at a time. See what prevents it from working.**make sure to disconnect the batt each time**. 

Let me know now what you find. Seeing a lot of this similar issue on these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: I've had the same things with me. I think on some its possible that <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> is half dead and hangs up POST. For the rest I have no idea

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: OK will try, the first one i got didnt work with a good known display, but now I just got another one in exactly the same issue. All voltages upto 1.05 sus are present but no display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: Ok the second one i got works with a good working display. SO thats gonna be an easy one :). For the other one waiting for the <CHIP>U4700</CHIP> and i will just try to swap it see if it makes a difference. I dont expect so, as there is no short there.
